edu.vt.middleware.dictionary
Class Dictionary

java.lang.Object
  edu.vt.middleware.dictionary.Dictionary

public class Dictionary
extends java.lang.Object

Dictionary is a class which manages a TernaryTree. Methods are provided for inserting data, sorting, and searching. Example: 

   import edu.vt.middleware.dictionary.Dictionary;

   String searchTerm = "my_search_term";
   Dictionary d = new Dictionary();
   d.useMedian();
   d.ignoreCase();
   d.insert(new java.io.File("my.dictionary"));
   d.build();
   if (dict.search(searchTerm)) {
     System.out.println(searchTerm+" was found in this dictionary");
   } else {
     System.out.println(searchTerm+" was not found in this dictionary");
   }

Version:
$Revision: 266 $ $Date: 2009-05-27 23:15:25 -0400 (Wed, 27 May 2009) $
Author:
Middleware Services

Constructor Detail

Dictionary

public Dictionary()
Default Constructor.

Method Detail

insert

public void insert(java.lang.String newWord)
This will insert the supplied word into the Dictionary. Empty lines are ignored. Lines beginning with '#' are ignored.

Parameters:
newWord - String to insert

insert

public void insert(java.lang.String[] newWords)
This will insert the supplied array of words into the Dictionary. See insert(String).

Parameters:
newWords - String[] to insert

insert

public void insert(java.io.File file)
            throws java.io.IOException
This will insert the words in the supplied file into the Dictionary. The file should contain one word per line or multiple words per line (Separated by whitespace). See insert(String).

Parameters:
file - File of words to insert
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an error occurs while reading from file

insert

public void insert(java.io.InputStream is)
            throws java.io.IOException
This will insert the words in the supplied inputstream into the Dictionary. The inputstream should contain one word per line or multiple words per line (Separated by whitespace). See insert(String).

Parameters:
is - InputStream of words to insert
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an error occurs while reading from the inputstream

bubbleSort

public void bubbleSort()
This will sort the words in this Dictionary using the bubble sort algorithm. This method must be called before build()

selectionSort

public void selectionSort()
This will sort the words in this Dictionary using the selection sort algorithm. This method must be called before build()

insertionSort

public void insertionSort()
This will sort the words in this Dictionary using the insertion sort algorithm. This method must be called before build()

quickSort

public void quickSort()
This will sort the words in this Dictionary using the quick sort algorithm. This method must be called before build()

quickSort

public void quickSort(int lo,
                      int hi)
This will sort the words in this Dictionary beginning at the lo index and ending at the hi index, using the quick sort algorithm. This method must be called before build()

Parameters:
lo - int index to beginning sorting at
hi - int index to stop sorting at

build

public void build()
This will build a ternary tree using any words that have been inserted into the Dictionary. This method must be called before any searching can be preformed. If useMedian() has been called, then data will be inserted beginning from the median.

search

public boolean search(java.lang.String word)
This will return true if the supplied word has been inserted into the Dictionary. This search is case sensitive. See TernaryTree.search(java.lang.String).

Parameters:
word - String to search for
Returns:
boolean - whether word was found

partialSearch

public java.lang.String[] partialSearch(java.lang.String word)
This will return an array of strings which partially match the supplied word. This search is case sensitive. See TernaryTree.partialSearch(java.lang.String).

Parameters:
word - String to search for
Returns:
String[] - of matching words

nearSearch

public java.lang.String[] nearSearch(java.lang.String word,
                                     int distance)
This will return an array of strings which are near to the supplied word by the supplied distance. This search is case sensitive. See TernaryTree.nearSearch(java.lang.String, int).

Parameters:
word - String to search for
distance - int for valid match
Returns:
String[] - of matching words

getWords

public java.lang.String[] getWords()
This will return an array of all the words in this Dictionary.

Returns:
String[] - of words

getCount

public int getCount()
This will return the number of words in this Dictionary.

Returns:
int - number of words

useMedian

public void useMedian()
This will cause data inserted into the Dictionary to be inserted beginning from the median. The default behavior inserts data from the beginning of any array or file which is inserted.

ignoreCase

public void ignoreCase()
This will cause data inserted into the Dictionary to be inserted in all lowercase. The default behavior inserts data when capitalization preserved. This method must be called before any data is inserted into the dictionary.

print

public void print(java.io.PrintWriter out)
This will print the contents of this Dictionary to the supplied PrintWriter. The output will show One word per line.

Parameters:
out - PrintWriter to print to

printTree

public void printTree(java.io.PrintWriter out)
This will print the contents of this Dictionary to the supplied PrintWriter. The output will attempt to show a tree structure.

Parameters:
out - PrintWriter to print to

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
This provides command line access to a Dictionary.

Parameters:
args - String[]
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if an error occurs
